 2.5 - INPUT MODALITIES
DRAGGING MOVEMENTS(LEVEL AA)
On accessible websites...

[New]

All functionality that uses a dragging movement for operation can be achieved by
a single pointer without dragging, unless dragging is essential.

These websites...

Make it easier for users to operate functionality through various inputs beyond
keyboard.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
A map allows users to drag the view of the map around, and the map has
up/down/left/right buttons to move the view as well. I still don't really
understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG22/Understanding/dragging-movements.html#examples]

Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 21 May 2021 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2021/WD-WCAG22-20210521/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
